cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 miles ENE of the north-western Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn west-southwest on Tuesday, move across the north-western Bahamas Wednesday, then track westward toward the Florida east coast and cross the peninsula into the Gulf late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida east coast between North Palm Beach and Volusia/Brevard County line

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach to north of Ocean Reef, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach, FL northward to Altamaha Sound, GA (PortMiami is south of the warning zone)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and east-central Florida coastline, especially Palm Beach to Brevard counties, with broader effects along the entire Florida east coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (forecast 1–2 ft for Biscayne Bay/ Miami area)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Wednesday into early Thursday; 42 % cumulative chance of sustained 34-kt winds, isolated gusts higher.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible along Biscayne Bay and Miami waterfront during high tide Wednesday night–Thursday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated pockets near 5 inches; brief flooding of low-lying terminal and roadway areas possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the port entrance channel; rough seas and elevated wave heights could restrict pilot operations and cruise/containership schedules.
